alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Covington. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving showers and a few thunderstorms moving across portions of central Covington County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain with locally higher amounts especially just south of Andalusia have likely fallen over the past hour. Additional heavy rainfall may result in ponding of water on roadways and flooding of low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Andalusia, Stanley, Horn Hill, Red Oak, Green Bay, Sanford, Babbie, Onycha, Huckaville, Wiggins, Carolina and Beulah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
